translation: Dharmagupta-bhadra-jikṣu-assembly XXI

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時佛在王舍城耆闍崛山中，與大比丘眾千二百五十人俱，皆阿羅漢，眾所知識。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was in the city of Rājagṛha on Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa with a great assembly of 1,250 monks, all arhats and all knowing consciousnesses.

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩五十人，得大神通變現自在，證無生忍及陀羅尼，其名曰：師子菩薩、師子慧菩薩、妙栴檀菩薩、調御菩薩、大調御菩薩、光勝菩薩、光現菩薩、光威菩薩、光嚴菩薩、明覺菩薩、眾上菩薩、調御眾生菩薩，及賢劫中一切菩薩，彌勒菩薩摩訶薩、文殊師利法王子等而為上首。
translation: Fifty of those bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, attained great mastery over manifestations, realized the patient acceptance of nonarising, and attained the dhāraṇī, and their names were Shizi Bodhisattva, Shizi Wisdom Bodhisattva, Myriad Sandalwood Bodhisattva, Taming Bodhisattva, Great Taming Bodhisattva, Radiant Victory Bodhisattva, Radiant Presence Bodhisattva, Radiant Power Bodhisattva, Radiant Adornment Bodhisattva, Luminous Enlightenment Bodhisattva, the Many Superior Bodhisattvas, the Bodhisattva Who Tames All Living Beings, Maitreya Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, and Mañjuśrī, the Dharma Prince, and so forth, who were the heads of those bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 復有四大天王、釋提桓因、娑婆世界主大梵天王，并諸無量天龍、夜叉、阿修羅、乾闥婆、緊那羅、摩睺羅伽等眾所圍遶。
translation: They're also surrounded by the four great celestial kings, Śakra Devānām-Indra, the lord of the sahā world, the king of the Brahmā gods, and measureless gods, dragons, yakṣas, asuras, gandharvas, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, and many others.

source_sentence: 如來世尊大名稱故普聞世間，所謂如來、應供、正遍知、明行足、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊，一切知者、一切見者，成就十力、四無所畏、四無礙解、十八不共法、大慈大悲，五眼具足，記說神變、教誨神變、神通神變皆悉圓滿。
translation: Because of his great reputation, the Tathāgata is universally heard in the world as the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, Perfectly Omniscient, Perfect in Knowledge, Well Gone, Understander of the World, Peerless, Trainer, Teacher of Gods and People, Buddha, World Honored, Knower of All, Seer of All, Accomplished in Ten Powers, Four Fearlessnesses, Four Unhindered Understandings, Eighteen Uncommon Dharmas, Greatly Compassionate, Complete in Five Eyes, and Complete in Explanation of His Transformations, Teaching of His Transformations, and His Transformations of His Powers.

source_sentence: 能以三千大千世界大地城邑草木叢林須彌山等、大海江河諸天宮殿，置一毛端令住虛空，或經一劫或過一劫，隨念所期而不傾動。
translation: He can take a large city, a forest, Sumeru mountains, or other large rivers and celestial palaces in a world of 3,000 great one-thousand worlds and place them at the tip of a hair, either after an eon or after an eon, and they won't budge according to his mind's desire.

source_sentence: 時王舍城國王大臣、婆羅門居士、一切人民，皆於如來深生尊重，以諸上妙飲食衣服臥具湯藥恭敬供養。
translation: The king of Rājagṛha, his ministers, the priests, and all the people there all deeply respected the Tathāgata and offered him reverence with fine food and drink, clothing, bedding, and medicine.

source_sentence: 於彼城中有一幻師名跋陀羅，善閑異論工巧呪術，於諸幻師最為上首。
translation: In that city, there was an illusionist named Bhadra who was skilled in conceptualization and technical incantations, and he was the foremost of the illusionists.

source_sentence: 摩竭提國唯除見諦之人，及於正信優婆塞優婆夷等，諸餘愚人皆被幻惑無不歸信。
translation: In Magadhātu, only those who see truly and those who are truly faithful like Upāsaka and Upāsikā, and the rest of the foolish are deluded by illusions, and none of them turn to him for faith.

source_sentence: 時彼幻師聞於如來功德名稱，便生是念：「今此城中一切眾生，悉皆於我生尊重心，唯有瞿曇沙門猶未信伏，我今應當往彼較試。
translation: When that illusionist heard the name of the Tathāgata's attributes, he had this thought, "Now, all the sentient beings in this city have respect for me, except for the Gautama ascetic, who still hasn't been convinced.

source_sentence: 彼若歸我，摩竭提人必皆於我倍加恭敬。」
translation: If they return to me, the people of Magadha will all pay me extra respect."

source_sentence: 時彼幻師宿殖善緣成熟時至，及由世尊威德力故，從王舍城往耆闍崛山。
translation: When the illusionist's long line of good causes had matured, and because of the Bhagavān's authoritative power, he went from Rājagṛha to Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa.

source_sentence: 覩佛光明踰百千日，面輪嚴好猶如滿月，身相圓滿如尼拘陀樹，毫相清淨如摩尼光，其目紺色如青蓮花，乃至梵天無能見頂，以六十種清淨音聲為眾說法。
translation: He saw the Buddha's radiance for more than a hundred thousand suns, his face as full as the full moon, his body as full as the nyagrodha tree, his facial features as pure as the maṇi light, and his eyes as violet as the blue lotus flower, and he spoke to the crowd with 60 pure sounds, even though no Brahma god could see his head.

source_sentence: 而此幻師雖覩如來威德特尊，猶懷邪慢，復更念言：「我今應當試驗於彼。
translation: Even though this illusionist saw the Tathāgata's outstanding attributes, he still harbored false pride and repeatedly thought, "Now, I should test him.

source_sentence: 若是一切知見之者應知我意。」
translation: If this is the case, then all those who know and see should know my intention."

source_sentence: 作是念已，前禮佛足而作是言：「願於明日受我微供。」
translation: After that thought, he bowed his head to the Buddha's feet and said, "May I accept your humble offerings tomorrow."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊觀彼幻師及王舍城諸眾生等根熟時至，為成熟故默然受請。
translation: The Bhagavān then observed that the illusionist and the sentient beings in Rājagṛha had arrived when their faculties were ripe, and he quietly accepted the invitation because it was ripe.

source_sentence: 時彼幻師既見世尊受其請已，復作是念：「今此瞿曇不識我意，定知非是一切智人。」
translation: After the illusionist saw the Bhagavān accept their invitation, he also thought, "Now, the Gautama doesn't know what I want, so he must know that he's not a person of omniscience."

source_sentence: 即便辭退作禮而去。
translation: He withdrew, paid homage, and departed.

source_sentence: 尊者目連時在會中，既覩斯事前白佛言：「此跋陀羅欲於如來及比丘眾有所欺誑，唯願世尊勿受其請。」
translation: Venerable Maudgalyāyana, who was present in the assembly at the time, saw this and said to the Buddha, "This Bhadra wants to deceive the Tathāgata and the community of monks, so I hope the Bhagavān won't accept his invitation."

source_sentence: 佛告目連：「莫作是念。
translation: The Buddha told Maudgalyāyana, "Don't think that.

source_sentence: 然貪瞋癡能為誑惑，我於是事久已斷滅，證得諸法本無生故。
translation: Although craving, ill-will, and delusion can be deceptive, I've long since ended it and realized that all dharmas are fundamentally unarisen.

source_sentence: 我於長劫安住正行，何有人能欺誑我者？
translation: How could anyone deceive me when I've been doing what's right for a long time?

source_sentence: 汝今當知，彼之所作非真幻化，如來所作是真幻化。
translation: Now, you should know that what they do isn't really illusory, but what the Tathāgata does is really illusory.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 現證諸法皆如幻故。
translation: It's because all the things we now realize are illusory.

source_sentence: 假使一切諸眾生類，皆成幻術如跋陀羅，比於如來，百分千分乃至算數譬喻所不能及。」
translation: Suppose all sentient beings of every kind were to become illusory like a bhadra, compared to the Tathāgata, a hundred percent, a thousand parts, or even an arithmetic metaphor couldn't match them."

source_sentence: 復告目連：「於意云何？
translation: Again, he asked Maudgalyāyana, "What do you think?

source_sentence: 彼之幻師頗能變現三千大千所有世界令嚴飾不？」
translation: How could their illusionists conjure up a world of 3,000 great one-thousand worlds to be adorned?"

source_sentence: 答言：「不也。」
translation: He replied, "No."

source_sentence: 「目連當知，我今能於一毛端中變現莊嚴恒沙世界，猶未盡於如來神力。
translation: "Maudgalyāyana should know that even though I can manifest a world adorned with the sands of the Ganges in a single hair, I still haven't exhausted the Tathāgata's miraculous powers.

source_sentence: 目連當知，有大風輪名為碎壞，彼能破壞三千世界。
translation: Maudgalyāyana, you should know that there's a great wind-wheel named Shattering, which is capable of destroying 3,000 worlds.

source_sentence: 復有風輪名毘嵐婆，能壞世界復能成立。
translation: There's another wind-wheel named vairambha that destroys worlds and creates them.

source_sentence: 復有風輪名為鼓動，彼風常能旋轉世界。
translation: There's another wind-wheel named agitation, which is capable of constantly rotating the world.

source_sentence: 復有風輪名為安住，彼風能行有頂之處。
translation: There's a wind-wheel named Stand, which is capable of traveling to the top of existence.

source_sentence: 復有風輪名為飄散，彼能飄散須彌山王及黑山等。
translation: There's another wind-wheel named disperser, which can disperse Mount Sumeru and the black mountains.

source_sentence: 復有風輪名為猛焰，劫火燒時能飄猛焰上至梵天。
translation: Another wind-wheel is named fierce flame, which when burned by an eon of fire can send fierce flames up to the Brahma heavens.

source_sentence: 復有風輪名為止息，劫火燒時彼能止息劫火所燒。
translation: There's another wind-wheel named Stillness, which can still the fires of the eon when they're burning.

source_sentence: 復有風輪名為清涼，能使一雲普覆三千大千世界。
translation: There's another wind-wheel named Cool, which can cause a single cloud to completely cover 3,000 great thousand worlds.

source_sentence: 復有風輪名為遍霔，劫火燒時普於世界降霔大雨。
translation: There's another wind-wheel named Pervasive Wetting, which sends down a deluge of rain throughout the world when the kalpa fires are burning.

source_sentence: 復有風輪名為乾竭，劫水漂時能令彼水悉皆枯涸。
translation: Another wind-wheel is called desiccation, which causes all the waters of the eon to dry up when they're floating.

source_sentence: 如是風輪，我若具說窮劫不盡。
translation: If I were to explain in detail such a wind-wheel, it wouldn't end for an entire eon.

source_sentence: 目連當知，於意云何？
translation: Mucilin should know, what do you think?

source_sentence: 此之幻師能於如是諸風輪中暫安住不？」
translation: Can this illusionist temporarily abide in such a wind-wheel?"

source_sentence: 答言：「不也。」
translation: He replied, "No."

source_sentence: 佛言目連：「如來能於如是風輪，行住坐臥得無搖動。
translation: The Buddha said to Maudgalyāyana, "The Tathāgata can walk, stand, sit, and lay down in such a wind-wheel without wavering.

source_sentence: 又復能以如是風輪內芥子中，現諸風輪所作之事，然於芥子無增無損，而諸風輪不相妨礙。
translation: He can also use such a wind-wheel to show what the wind-wheels do inside a mustard seed, yet there's no increase or decrease in the mustard seed, and the wind-wheels aren't obstructed by each other.

source_sentence: 目連當知，如來成就幻術之法無有限極。」
translation: Mucilin should know that the Tathāgata's accomplishment of illusory techniques has no limit."

source_sentence: 爾時尊者大目乾連及諸大眾，聞於如來作是說時，生希有心頂禮佛足，同聲唱言：「我等今者遇大威德神通導師，獲大饒益。
translation: When the Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana and the crowd heard the Tathāgata say that, they bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet in hope and chanted with one voice, "Now, we've met a teacher of great authority and supernormal powers who has greatly benefited us.

source_sentence: 若有得聞如來世尊如是神力深生信解，此人必當獲大善利，發於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心。」
translation: If someone hears of the Tathāgata's supernormal powers and deeply believes in them, they will surely attain great good benefits and arouse the mind of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment."

source_sentence: 時彼幻師即於其夜詣王舍城，於最下劣穢惡之處，化作道場寬廣平正，繒綵幡蓋種種莊嚴，散諸花香覆以寶帳。
translation: That illusionist then went to the city of Rājagṛha that night and created a wide and level site of enlightenment in the least despicable and filthy place, decorated with silken banners and flags, and covered with a jeweled canopy scattered with flowers and fragrances.

source_sentence: 復現八千諸寶行樹，其寶樹下一一皆有師子之座，無量敷具悉皆嚴好。
translation: There were also 8,000 jeweled rows of trees, each with a lion's seat underneath it, and measureless spreads of equipment, all of which were well-decorated.

source_sentence: 為欲供養諸比丘故，而復化為百味飲食，并現五百給侍之人，服以白衣飾以嚴具。
translation: With the intention of making offerings to the monks, he then transforms them into a hundred flavors of food and drink and produces 500 attendants dressed in white robes and adorned with ornaments.

source_sentence: 作是化已，時四天王來至會中，告幻師言：「汝於明日為供如來，化作如是無量嚴具，由是因緣獲大功德。
translation: After this transformation, the four heavenly kings came to the assembly and told the illusionist, "Tomorrow, you will create this measureless array of finery to offer to the Tathāgata, and because of this cause you'll attain great merit.

source_sentence: 我今為欲助於汝故，供養如來，於此化為第二道場。
translation: Now, I want to help you by making offerings to the Tathāgata and turning this into the second site of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 頗能聽不？」
translation: Will you listen?"

source_sentence: 時彼幻師聞是語已，生奇特心，即便聽許。
translation: After hearing those words, the illusionist had a peculiar feeling and even gave his approval.

source_sentence: 於是四王即便變現無量殊妙莊嚴之具，倍於幻師幻化之事。
translation: The four kings then transformed themselves into measureless, marvelous adornments that doubled the illusionist's illusory creations.

source_sentence: 時天帝釋復與三萬諸天子等來詣道場，語幻師言：「我今亦欲因汝供養莊嚴道場。」
translation: Śakra then again visited the site of enlightenment with 30,000 gods and sons and said to the illusionist, "Now, I also want to make offerings to you to adorn the site of enlightenment."

source_sentence: 幻師驚悚又便聽許。
translation: Frightened, the illusionist then complied.

source_sentence: 於是天帝為如來故化作堂宇，猶如三十三天殊勝之殿。
translation: Tendai then created a hall for the Tathāgata's sake, resembling the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven's extraordinary palace.

source_sentence: 又復化作波利質多、俱鞞陀羅、天妙樹等，次第行列。
translation: He also transformed them into a succession of such things as the pārijāta, the kuṇḍaras, and the heavenly marvelous trees.

source_sentence: 幻師爾時見斯事已，嗟歎驚悔欲攝所化，盡其呪術幻化之事宛然如故。
translation: After seeing this, the illusionist was overcome with admiration and remorse, wanting to subsume what he had conjured up, but the illusory things he conjured up with his spell remained exactly as they were.

source_sentence: 便自思念：「此為甚奇。
translation: He then thought to himself, "This is quite amazing.

source_sentence: 我從昔來於所變化隱現從心。
translation: Since the distant past, I've been able to conceal what's changed and show it according to my mind.

source_sentence: 而於今時不能隱沒，必由為彼如來故然。」
translation: Now, I can't hide it, because it must be for that Tathāgata."

source_sentence: 時天帝釋知彼心念，告幻師言：「汝於今者為如來故莊嚴道場，無能隱沒。
translation: Then, knowing what they were thinking, Indra told the illusionist, "Now, you've adorned the site of enlightenment for the Tathāgata's sake, but you're not able to hide.

source_sentence: 以是當知，若復有人於如來所，乃至發於一念之心，由斯善本畢竟能作般涅槃因。」
translation: Therefore, you should know that if another person were to give rise to even a single thought in the Tathāgata's presence, this good root would ultimately be the cause of parinirvāṇa."

source_sentence: 彼聞天帝作如是說，心甚歡喜。
translation: When he heard that the god Ti had said this, his heart rejoiced.

source_sentence: 過夜分已，往如來所白言：「世尊！
translation: After the evening portion, he went to the Tathāgata and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於今時營辦已訖，願垂哀慜。」
translation: Now that I've finished my work, I beg your pity."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊於晨朝時著衣持鉢，與諸大眾恭敬圍遶，入王舍城赴彼幻師道場之所。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān put on his robe and took his bowl in the morning, surrounded himself with the crowd in respect, and went into Rājagṛha to meet that illusionist at his place of practice.

source_sentence: 摩竭提國外道梵志婆羅門等，咸願如來為於幻師之所幻惑，為欲見故皆來集會。
translation: The Brahmins and other priests from outside Magadhā who wished the Tathāgata was deluded by the illusionist came to assemble because they wanted to see him.

source_sentence: 諸比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷，樂欲見聞如來神變及師子吼，亦皆集會。
translation: The monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen who wanted to see and hear the Tathāgata's miraculous transformation and lion's roar also assembled.

source_sentence: 爾時如來以佛神力，令彼幻師、帝釋、四王各見世尊在於已所莊嚴之處。
translation: At the time, the Tathāgata used the Buddha's miraculous powers to cause the conjurer, Indra, and the four kings to each see the Bhagavān in the place where he had been adorned.

source_sentence: 彼時幻師既見是已，捨於憍慢，前禮佛足，白言：「世尊！
translation: After they saw this, the magician abandoned his pride, saluted the Buddha's feet, and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今於如來悔過發露。
translation: "Now, the Tathāgata repents and reveals his error.

source_sentence: 我先於佛妄生欺誑，幻化種種莊嚴之事。
translation: I was deceived by the Buddha and created various illusory and ornate things.

source_sentence: 後雖漸悔，無能隱沒。」
translation: Although I gradually repented later, I wasn't able to hide them."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告幻師言：「一切眾生及諸資具皆是幻化，謂由於業之所幻故。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the illusionist, "All sentient beings and their necessities are illusory, meaning that they are created by the illusion of karma.

source_sentence: 諸比丘眾亦是幻化，謂由於法之所幻故。
translation: All the bhikṣus are also illusory, which is to say that they are illusory because of the illusion of things.

source_sentence: 我身亦幻，智所幻故。
translation: My body is also illusory, which is the result of the illusion of knowledge.

source_sentence: 三千大千一切世界亦皆是幻，一切眾生共所幻故。
translation: All of the 3,000 great one-thousand worlds are also illusory, which is because all sentient beings are illusory in common.

source_sentence: 凡所有法無非是幻，因緣和合之所幻故。
translation: All dharmas are nothing but illusory, because they're illusory due to the combination of causes and conditions.

source_sentence: 汝今應以幻化飲食隨次而行。」
translation: Now, you should follow the illusory food and drink in order."

source_sentence: 時彼幻師與四天王、釋提桓因并來眷屬，及所幻化給侍人等，即持飲食施佛及僧，同會眾人悉皆充足。
translation: The illusionist, the four heavenly kings, Śakra Devānām-Indra, their retinues, and their illusory attendants then took the food and drink and gave it to the Buddha and the saṃgha, and the people in the assembly were all supplied with it.

source_sentence: 爾時摩訶迦葉而說偈曰：「知食是幻化，　　受者亦復然，　了此平等時，　　乃名為淨施。」
translation: It was then that Mahākāśyapa spoke a verse, "When you know that food is illusory, and the recipient is likewise, and you understand this equality, then it's called pure giving."

source_sentence: 大目乾連曰：「知座是幻化，　　坐者亦復然，　了此平等時，　　乃名為淨施。」
translation: Mahāmaudgalyāyana said, "When you know that a seat is illusory and the person sitting there is likewise, and when you know this equality, then it's called pure giving."

source_sentence: 舍利弗曰：「如化給侍人，　　受者心亦然，　施者能如是，　　乃名為淨施。」
translation: Śāriputra said, "Just as a magically conjured person serves a person, the recipient's mind is likewise, and the donor is able to do so, then it's called pure generosity."

source_sentence: 須菩提曰：「勿以施為施，　　勿以受為受，　施者能如是，　　乃名為淨施。」
translation: Subhūti said, "Don't think of giving as giving, and don't think of receiving as receiving; the giver can thus give, and it's called pure giving."

source_sentence: 阿難陀曰：「所施如虛空，　　受者不可得，　遠離於身心，　　其施最清淨。」
translation: Ānanda said, "A gift is like space, the recipient can't get it, it's far removed from body and mind, and it's the purest gift."

source_sentence: 光幢菩薩曰：「譬如彼幻師，　　幻化莊嚴事，　諸法皆如是，　　愚人不覺知。」
translation: Guangzang Pusa said, "It's like that illusionist who conjures up adornments, for which all things are thus, but foolish people don't realize it."

source_sentence: 光嚴菩薩曰：「如座及諸樹，　　皆幻心所為，　幻心與虛空，　　何有少差別？」
translation: The Vairocana Bodhisattva said, "Such as seats and trees, they are all created by an illusory mind, and what small difference is there between an illusory mind and space?"

source_sentence: 師子菩薩曰：「野干未曾聞，　　師子所哮吼，　其心無所懼，　　嘷叫林樹間，　適聞師子聲，　　藏竄而無所。
translation: "The lion bodhisattva says, 'Never has a wilderness trunk heard the lion's roar, and his mind has no fear as he cries out among the trees, he hears the lion's voice and hides without a place to go.'

source_sentence: 幻師亦如是，　　不對如來前，　常於外道中，　　自讚超過佛。
translation: An illusionist is likewise, not facing the Tathāgata, but always praising himself as surpassing the Buddha among non-Buddhists.

source_sentence: 幻師雖造作，　　幻術有其邊，　如來所成就，　　幻術無窮盡，　一切諸天魔，　　莫能知邊際。」
translation: Although an illusionist creates illusions, there are limits to their techniques, and what the Tathāgata accomplishes is so inexhaustible that none of the gods or demons can know the limits."

source_sentence: 師子慧菩薩曰：「了知給侍人，　　飲食并食者，　一切皆幻化，　　善施無過上。」
translation: Shizi Hui said, "He knows that the people he serves, the food and drink he eats, and the people he feeds are all illusory, and his generosity is unsurpassed."

source_sentence: 彌勒菩薩曰：「如火得蘇油，　　展轉而增盛，　世尊對幻師，　　幻化亦如是。」
translation: Maitreya Bodhisattva said, "Like a fire that gets sesame oil and proliferates, the Bhagavān confronts illusory teachers, and so do illusory transformations."

source_sentence: 文殊師利菩薩曰：「此會眾善事，　　如本未曾為，　一切法皆然，　　常等於前際。」
translation: Mañjuśrī Bodhisattva said, "This assembly of many good deeds is like nothing that has ever been done before, which is true of all dharmas and is always the same as the previous one."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊為欲成熟彼幻師故，化一長者入於會中，謂幻師曰：「汝今於此欲何所作？」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān, wishing to ripen that illusionist, transformed an elderly man into the assembly and said to the illusionist, "What do you want to do here now?"

source_sentence: 幻師答言：「我為供養沙門瞿曇設諸飲食。」
translation: The magician replied, "I've prepared food and drink to support the ascetic Gautama."

source_sentence: 長者告言：「莫作是說。
translation: The elder told him, "Don't say that.

source_sentence: 如來今者與諸比丘，在闍王宮受供而食。」
translation: The Tathāgata is now with the monks in the Ajātaśatru's palace, accepting offerings and eating."

source_sentence: 佛神力故，令彼幻師見於如來與諸比丘在彼而食。
translation: Because of the Buddha's miraculous power, the magician saw the Tathāgata and the monks there, eating.

source_sentence: 又復化作第二長者，謂幻師言：「汝何所作？」
translation: He also took the form of a second elder who said to the illusionist, "What are you doing?"

source_sentence: 幻師答言：「我為供養沙門瞿曇。」
translation: The magician replied, "I'm making offerings to the ascetic Gautama."

source_sentence: 長者復言：「莫作是說。
translation: The elder then replied, "Don't say that.

source_sentence: 如來今者與諸比丘，在於梵志里巷之中巡行乞食。」
translation: The Tathāgata and the monks are now walking around with the priests in the alleys, begging for food."

source_sentence: 佛神力故，令彼幻師還見如來與諸聖眾在里巷中巡行乞食。
translation: Because of the Buddha's supernormal power, the illusionist then saw the Tathāgata and the noble people walking around begging for food in the alleyway.

source_sentence: 又復化作第三長者，告幻師言：「如來今者在彼醫王耆婆園中，為諸四眾宣說妙法。」
translation: Again, he took the form of a third elder who told the illusionist, "The Tathāgata is now in that Gṛdhrakūṭa's garden, teaching the wonderful Dharma to the four groups of people."

source_sentence: 佛神力故，令彼幻師皆見如是。
translation: Because of the Buddha's supernormal power, the illusionists all saw it that way.

source_sentence: 次復化作釋提桓因，來詣幻師而復告言：「如來今在三十三天為眾說法。」
translation: Next, he transformed into Śakrodevānām Indra, came to the illusionist, and again told him, "The Tathāgata is now in the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven, preaching the Dharma for the multitude."

source_sentence: 彼時幻師復見如來在天眾中演諸法要。
translation: The conjurer then again saw the Tathāgata expounding the essentials of the Dharma among the multitude of gods.

source_sentence: 爾時幻師復於林樹花葉之間，及諸一切師子座上，并王舍城里巷垣牆室宅堂殿及諸勝處，皆見如來具諸相好。
translation: The conjurer then saw the Tathāgata in all his splendid appearances among the trees and flowers, on the lion's seat, in the lanes, walls, halls, and chambers of Rājagṛha, and in all the other outstanding places.

source_sentence: 亦於一切諸如來所，自見己身悔過發露。
translation: He also saw himself in all the tathāgatas' places, repenting and revealing his faults.

source_sentence: 彼時幻師唯見佛身，餘無所見，歡喜踊躍而便獲於念佛三昧。
translation: The illusionist then saw only the Buddha's body and nothing else, and he rejoiced and jumped for joy as he then attained the concentration of mindfulness of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 從三昧起合掌向佛，而說偈言：「我昔於閻浮，　　幻化無過上，　今比佛神通，　　無能及少分。
translation: Rising from that concentration, he put his palms together and pointed them at the Buddha, saying, "In the past, I conjured up nothing greater than Yama, but now I compare myself to the Buddha's supernormal powers, which are unsurpassed by even a small part.

source_sentence: 由是方了知，　　諸佛難思力，　隨心能變現，　　化佛如恒沙。
translation: Thus, we realized that the inconceivable powers of the buddhas can manifest themselves according to the mind, transforming buddhas like sands.

source_sentence: 所見諸如來，　　皆具於相好，　願尊為顯示，　　何者是真佛？
translation: All the tathāgatas I've seen are fully endowed with their appearance, so may Your Holiness show me which one is the true Buddha?

source_sentence: 於此諸如來，　　我欲修供養，　願尊為我說，　　何者為勝果？
translation: "Here, Tathāgatas, I want to make offerings, may Your Holiness explain for me what is the fruit of excellence?

source_sentence: 若人於佛所，　　不生尊重心，　如是諸凡夫，　　退失於安樂。
translation: "If people don't have respect for the Buddha's presence, such worldlings regress and lose their well-being.

source_sentence: 今於世尊前，　　發露先所犯，　妄試如來罪，　　永願滅無餘。
translation: Now, before the Bhagavān, I've revealed my prior transgressions, my false testimony about the Tathāgata's faults, and my eternal desire to extinguish them without remainder.

source_sentence: 梵釋并大眾，　　願皆證知我，　為度諸群生，　　今發菩提心。
translation: May Brahmā, Śakra, and the general public all realize that I, in order to save all sentient beings, now give rise to the mind of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 以智慧光明，　　覺悟於世間，　施與甘露法，　　悉皆令充滿。
translation: With the light of wisdom, I awaken the world and bestow the Dharma of ambrosia, which will fill them all.

source_sentence: 若人於佛所，　　見如是神變，　及聞悅意言，　　勝行無礙智。
translation: If someone sees such a miraculous transformation in the Buddha's presence and hears pleasing words, they will surpass the practice of unhindered cognition.

source_sentence: 何有明慧者，　　不發菩提心？
translation: What is there that person of insight who doesn't give rise to the mind of enlightenment?

source_sentence: 願示菩提道，　　及遍清淨行。
translation: "May the path to enlightenment be revealed, and the practice of pervasive purity be practiced.

source_sentence: 何等為修行，　　二乘不能入？
translation: What's this practice that the two vehicles can't enter?

source_sentence: 云何所行處，　　尊重而供養？
translation: "What is the place of practice that is respected and offered?

source_sentence: 云何具威儀，　　及離諸疑悔？
translation: "How are they properly mannered and free of doubt and remorse?

source_sentence: 云何於多聞，　　無厭修堅實？
translation: "How is it that when one is well-versed, one doesn't tire of cultivating the firm?

source_sentence: 云何為人說，　　令樂於正法，　無希利養心，　　及善知恩報？
translation: How do you explain this to people, causing them to delight in the right teaching, have no desire to improve themselves, and know well the rewards of kindness?

source_sentence: 云何於眾生，　　常為不壞友？
translation: "How are these sentient beings always indestructible friends?

source_sentence: 云何近善友，　　捨離惡知識？
translation: "How do you approach a good friend and abandon a bad friend?

source_sentence: 云何值諸佛，　　供養心無倦？
translation: "How do you meet the buddhas and make offerings without wearying?

source_sentence: 云何為學處，　　尊重及清淨？
translation: "What are the bases of training, respect, and purity?

source_sentence: 云何定種姓，　　成就如理心？
translation: "What is the determined seed-nature that accomplishes a mind in accord with reality?

source_sentence: 及捨不如理，　　具足正思惟？
translation: and abandoning what's not reasonable, with perfect correct contemplation?

source_sentence: 云何無怯弱，　　不為魔所攝，　思惟於義理，　　不捨諸眾生？
translation: How can you be unintimidated, not be subject to Māra, contemplate the principle of meaning, and not abandon all sentient beings?

source_sentence: 云何不應捨，　　不取而攝取，　得入於正行，　　具足善方便？
translation: Why don't they just let go, take what's not taken, and enter into right practice, replete with good skillful means?

source_sentence: 云何修慈悲，　　成就諸神通，　證於無礙辯，　　及得陀羅尼？
translation: "How do you cultivate compassion, achieve supernormal powers, realize unhindered eloquence, and attain the dhāraṇī?

source_sentence: 云何獲法忍，　　清淨之辯才，　當捨應捨法，　　得入甚深義？
translation: "How can you attain the tolerance of dharmas, the pure eloquence that will abandon what should be abandoned and enter their profound meaning?

source_sentence: 云何於誓願，　　一切皆圓滿，　於諸波羅蜜，　　而得不退轉？
translation: "How are all vows perfected and the perfections attained without turning back?

source_sentence: 我於如是法，　　當願勤修行，　唯願大悲尊，　　為我廣宣說。」
translation: I must wish to diligently practice this teaching, and may the greatly compassionate one explain it for me in detail."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊以偈答曰：「若了一切法，　　皆同於幻化，　是人則能現，　　百億諸佛身，　往於俱胝剎，　　度脫諸眾生。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān answered in a verse, "If he understands that all things are the same as illusory transformations, then he'll be able to manifest ten billion buddha bodies, travel to cordial bases, and liberate sentient beings.

source_sentence: 譬如跋陀羅，　　無色現眾色，　不生亦不滅，　　無住無去來。
translation: Like Bhadra, he shows many forms without form, doesn't arise or cease, and has neither abiding nor going nor coming.

source_sentence: 世尊變化身，　　及與比丘眾，　亦無有生滅，　　乃至於涅槃。
translation: The Bhagavān's transformation body and his assembly of monks also lack birth and death, even up to nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 此皆是如來，　　不思議神變，　亦如幻化者，　　現象馬軍陣。
translation: These are all inconceivable miracles of the Tathāgata, just like the illusory transformation that shows up as an elephant, a horse, or a military column.

source_sentence: 迷惑諸眾生，　　妄見為真實，　如是象馬軍，　　無性亦無生。
translation: Deluded sentient beings falsely believe this to be true, for such an army of elephants and horses is neither natureless nor unarisen.

source_sentence: 諸佛無色相，　　無去亦無來，　住於我見人，　　妄生於佛想。
translation: The buddhas lack form and shape, have neither past nor future, and people who abide in a view of self falsely conceptualize the buddhas.

source_sentence: 不應以色相，　　種族及生處，　乃至梵音聲，　　而欲觀如來。
translation: They shouldn't want to contemplate the Tathāgata based on form, lineage, birthplace, or even the sound of the Brahma.

source_sentence: 亦難以心識，　　分別於諸佛，　諸佛法性身，　　超過於三世。
translation: It's also difficult for the mind and consciousness to discriminate among the buddhas, whose Dharma-nature bodies transcend the three worlds.

source_sentence: 自性離諸相，　　不墮於法數，　所現諸如來，　　自性無生起，　亦無蘊界處，　　住於無所依，　如是佛法身，　　非五眼能見。
translation: Their own nature is free of characteristics, they don't fall into the number of things, and the tathāgatas they present have an own-nature that's not produced, have no aggregates or realms, and reside in a basis that has nothing, such is the Buddha's Dharma body that can't be seen by the five eyes.

source_sentence: 若謂我見佛，　　是則不能見，　以無見為見，　　如空中鳥跡。
translation: If someone says I see the Buddha, then they can't see it, and they see it because they don't see it, like the traces of a bird in the air.

source_sentence: 如汝所見佛，　　及餘未見者，　平等如虛空，　　一相無差別。
translation: Thus, the buddhas you've seen and others you haven't seen are equal like space, with no distinctions in their single aspect.

source_sentence: 戒定慧解脫，　　及解脫知見，　一切諸如來，　　功德無差別，　皆住於空性，　　於法無所著，　一切皆幻化，　　無性亦無生。
translation: With morality, meditation, wisdom, liberation, and the knowledge and vision of liberation, all the tathāgatas have no distinctions in merit, all abide in emptiness, attach to nothing in dharmas, all are illusory, and lack nature and are unarisen.

source_sentence: 供養一如來，　　則供於多佛，　諸佛之法身，　　平等無差別。
translation: When making offerings to the Tathāgata, they make offerings to many buddhas, whose Dharma bodies are equal and without distinctions.

source_sentence: 如是一切佛，　　咸能生福利，　普施諸如來，　　皆獲於大果。
translation: Thus, all buddhas are capable of producing benefit, and they all attain great realization when they give generously to the tathāgatas.

source_sentence: 同證於平等，　　清淨之法性，　是故諸如來，　　無種種差別。
translation: They all equally realize the equality and purity of the Dharma nature, and therefore there are no distinctions among the tathāgatas.

source_sentence: 如汝先所問，　　何者為真佛？
translation: As you asked earlier, "What's the true Buddha?

source_sentence: 當捨散亂心，　　諦聽我宣說。
translation: "Let go of distracted thought and listen closely to what I've taught you.

source_sentence: 應住正念慧，　　觀察於諸法，　一切皆無生，　　妄見為真實。
translation: You should abide in the wisdom of right mindfulness, observing all dharmas, which are all unarisen and whose false views are real.

source_sentence: 色相若有生，　　則應亦有滅，　是故諸如來，　　畢竟無有生。
translation: If there's birth in form and form, then there should also be cessation; therefore, tathāgatas, after all, have no birth.

source_sentence: 彼亦非己生，　　亦無有散滅，　由是觀如來，　　以無見為見，　如汝所見佛，　　不依止方所。
translation: Nor are they themselves born, nor are they scattered or extinguished; thus, they contemplate the tathāgata as having no view, just as you see the Buddha, and don't rely on a place or object.

source_sentence: 一切諸凡夫，　　皆依於五蘊，　應當於彼蘊，　　如佛而觀察。
translation: All worldlings rely on the five aggregates, so they should observe those aggregates as buddhas do.

source_sentence: 諸佛及諸法，　　乃至於眾生，　以無相為相，　　無有依止者，　若作是觀察，　　速證於菩提。
translation: All buddhas and dharmas, even sentient beings, take marklessness as mark and have no basis, so if you observe them this way, you'll quickly realize enlightenment.

source_sentence: 諸法皆非有，　　由妄分別生，　因緣體性空，　　離作者性故。
translation: All dharmas are not existent, but arise from false discrimination, are empty of the essence of causes and conditions, and are free of their authorship.

source_sentence: 如是能了達，　　因緣作者空，　彼則能了知，　　離染清淨法，　以清淨法眼，　　得見諸如來。」
translation: Being able to thus comprehend that the author of causes and conditions is empty, they'll be able to comprehend that they're free of defiled and pure dharmas, and with the pure Dharma eye, they'll be able to see the tathāgatas."

source_sentence: 時彼幻師聞是說已得順法忍，五千眾生發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，二百菩薩證無生忍。
translation: After hearing this, the magician attained the tolerance of the conventional dharma, 5,000 sentient beings aroused the mind of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment, and 200 bodhisattvas realized the tolerance of nonarising.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊飯食已訖，欲滿幻師所施願故，復說偈言：「能於所施物，　　施者及受人，　等無分別心，　　是則施圓滿。」
translation: After he had finished his meal, the Bhagavān wished to fulfill the illusionist's vow to give, and then he spoke a verse, saying, "If the donor and the recipient of the gift can be equal without discriminating between their minds, then the gift will be complete."

source_sentence: 爾時阿難白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that Ānanda said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我等願於如來以佛神力加持幻師，今所施設莊嚴之事，於七日中令不隱沒。」
translation: We wish that the Tathāgata would bestow upon the illusionist the adornment that he has now bestowed by the Buddha's supernormal power, so that it won't be hidden during the seven days."

source_sentence: 是時如來為眾請故，令彼幻師幻化道場，滿足七日嚴飾如故。
translation: At that point, the Tathāgata, at the request of the crowd, caused that illusionist to conjure up a site of enlightenment that would be decorated as before for seven days.

source_sentence: 爾時如來與諸比丘及大菩薩，天龍、夜叉、乾闥婆等恭敬圍遶，還耆闍崛山為眾說法。
translation: The Tathāgata then returned to Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa with the monks, great bodhisattvas, gods, dragons, yakṣas, and gandharvas respectfully surrounding him as he taught the Dharma to the crowd.

source_sentence: 爾時幻師復往佛所頂禮佛足，右遶三匝却住一面，而白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The magician then went back to the Buddha, bowed his head at his feet, circled him three times to his right, withdrew to one side, and said to him, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 願為演說諸菩薩道，勤修行者速當得至菩提道場。」
translation: May I explain the bodhisattva paths for you, so that those who diligently practice them will quickly reach the site of the enlightenment path."

source_sentence: 佛言：「諦聽，善思念之，當為汝說。」
translation: The Buddha said, "Listen closely, consider it well, and I will explain it for you."

source_sentence: 幻師白言：「唯然世尊！
translation: The magician said, "Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 願樂欲聞。」
translation: May I wish to hear about it."

source_sentence: 佛言：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha said, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 有四種法是菩薩道。
translation: "There are four kinds of things that are the bodhisattva path.

source_sentence: 若能修行，速當得至菩提道場。
translation: If you can cultivate them, you'll quickly reach the site of the enlightenment path.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者於菩提心永不退失，二者於諸眾生常無棄捨，三者一切善根求無厭足，四者護持正法起大精進。
translation: First, they never lose their mind for enlightenment, second, they never discard sentient beings, third, they never tire of seeking out all good roots, and fourth, they guard the right teaching and muster great effort.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 菩薩復有四法遍清淨行。
translation: "Again, bodhisattvas have four things that they do that are pervasively pure.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者律儀清淨，二者意樂清淨，三者智慧清淨，四者受生清淨。
translation: 1) purity of restraint, 2) purity of intention, 3) purity of wisdom, and 4) purity of sensation produced.

source_sentence: 復有四法，唯菩薩行，非彼二乘之所能入。
translation: There are another four things that only bodhisattvas practice and that can't be entered by the two vehicles.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者修習禪定而不隨生，二者於甚深義心能簡擇，三者於諸眾生起大悲心，四者種種辯才演法無礙。
translation: One cultivates meditation without following birth, two is able to discern profound meanings in his mind, three arouses great compassion for sentient beings, and four speaks the Dharma without obstruction with various kinds of eloquence.

source_sentence: 復有四法所行之處。
translation: There are also four other things that they practice.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者樂住閑寂，二者厭於憒閙，三者於諸眾生起大慈心，四者能了諸行無有去來。
translation: One is happy to abide in quietude, two is disillusioned with hustle and bustle, three has great compassion for sentient beings, and four can understand that practices have no going or coming.

source_sentence: 復有四法尊重供養。
translation: There are also four things that he respects and makes offerings to.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者不惜身命，二者心常歡悅，三者捨離憍慢，四者如說修行。
translation: One doesn't spare his life, two is always happy in his mind, three abandons pride, and four cultivates it as he's taught.

source_sentence: 復有四法威儀具足：一者知時，二者知處，三者寂靜，四者真實。
translation: There are also four other things with which their manner is complete: one, knowing the time, two, knowing the place, three, quiescence, and four, truth.

source_sentence: 「復有四法能離疑悔。
translation: "Again, there are four things that can free you from doubt and remorse.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者於惡作事應預防護，二者於諸智人當樂親近，三者於所聞義常善思惟，四者不以慈心不舉他過。
translation: 1) You must guard against evil actions, 2) you must delight in being close to wise people, 3) you must always well consider the meaning of what you've heard, and 4) you mustn't hold up other's faults with kindness.

source_sentence: 復有四法多聞無厭。
translation: There are another four things that hears a lot about and doesn't tire of.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者增長自他正智慧故，二者於他疑惑能斷除故，三者於佛正法能攝受故，四者於諸如來讚無盡故。
translation: One, it's because they increase their own right wisdom and that of others, two, it's because they can remove doubt and confusion in others, three, it's because they can take in the Buddha's right teaching, and four, it's because they praise the Tathāgatas endlessly.

source_sentence: 復有四法多聞堅實。
translation: There are another four things that are well-versed and resolute.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者聞正法已能善解了，二者聞正法已不作諸惡，三者聞正法已為他開示，四者聞正法已迴向菩提。
translation: One, after hearing the right teaching, they can well understand it, two, after hearing the right teaching, they don't do evil, three, after hearing the right teaching, they reveal it for others, and four, after hearing the right teaching, they turn to bodhi.

source_sentence: 復有四法說法利益。
translation: There are another four benefits of preaching the Dharma.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者常受他人香味飲食，二者恒受衣服種種供養，三者令魔眷屬勢力羸弱，四者諸天護持魔不得便。
translation: One, they'll always accept fragrant food and drink from others, two, they'll always accept various offerings of clothing, three, they'll weaken the power of Māra's followers, and four, the gods will defend Māra from getting an advantage over him.

source_sentence: 復有四法令他信樂所說之法。
translation: There are also four other things that cause others to believe and enjoy the teaching.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者心少欲故，二者常知足故，三者語柔軟故，四者身順法故。
translation: One is because his mind lacks desire, two is because he's always satisfied, three is because his words are gentle, and four is because his body conforms to the teaching.

source_sentence: 復有四法能演正法無有希望。
translation: There are another four things that teach the right Dharma without hope.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者於生死中恒懷怖畏，二者不求世間利養親友，三者於諸眾生常生擁護，四者於諸聖種而能修習。
translation: One is always fearful in birth-and-death, two doesn't seek worldly gain or friends and relatives, three is always supportive of sentient beings, and four is able to cultivate the noble lineages.

source_sentence: 復有四法知恩報恩。
translation: There are also four ways to know and repay kindness.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者勸諸眾生趣菩提故，二者知所作業不失壞故，三者慈愛眾生如己身故，四者善能修行菩薩事故。
translation: One encourages sentient beings to go to bodhi, two knows that the actions they take won't be lost or destroyed, three loves sentient beings as themselves, and four is well able to cultivate bodhisattva practices.

source_sentence: 復有四法於諸眾生為不壞友。
translation: There are another four things that make sentient beings indestructible friends.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者能被忍辱大甲冑故，二者福利眾生不求報故，三者於大悲心常不退故，四者雖多惱害亦不捨故。
translation: One, it's because he's capable of wearing the great armor of forbearance, two, it's because he benefits sentient beings and doesn't seek rewards, three, it's because he's always mindful of great compassion and doesn't back down, and four, it's because he doesn't abandon even though he's often troubled.

source_sentence: 復有四法於諸善友應當親近。
translation: "Again, there are four things that you should do to become close to good friends.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者成就善巧方便，二者成就殊勝意樂，三者成就菩薩正行，四者成就勸讚菩提。
translation: One accomplishes skillful means, two accomplishes superior aspirations, three accomplishes the bodhisattva's correct practices, and four accomplishes the praise of bodhi.

source_sentence: 復有四法於諸惡友應當捨離。
translation: "Again, there are four things that bad friends should abandon.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者讚說二乘，二者令退菩提，三者增長惡法，四者損壞諸善。
translation: One praises the two vehicles, two causes setbacks from enlightenment, three increases bad qualities, and four damages goodness.

source_sentence: 復有四法得值諸佛。
translation: There are another four ways to attain Buddhahood.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者恒以一心專念佛故，二者稱讚如來諸功德故，三者所受律儀遍清淨故，四者以勝意樂發弘願故。
translation: One, it's because he's constantly focused on the Buddha with a single mind, two, it's because he praises the Tathāgata's virtues, three, it's because the precepts he receives are completely pure, and four, it's because he gives rise to the vast vow with superior intent.

source_sentence: 復有四法供養諸佛心無懈惓。
translation: There are also four ways to make offerings to the buddhas without laziness of mind.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者應自慶快我今供養最上福田，二者由我供養一切眾生亦當供養，三者因供養已於菩提心當得堅固，四者覩於如來三十二相善根增長。
translation: First, I should rejoice in my own happiness because I'm now making offerings to the most excellent field of merit; second, I should make offerings to all sentient beings because of my offerings; third, my mind for enlightenment will be strengthened as a result of making offerings; and fourth, I'll see the Tathāgata's thirty-two marks growing in good roots.

source_sentence: 復有四法於諸學處生尊重心。
translation: There are also four ways to give rise to a respectful attitude in the places of training.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者超過惡道，二者得生善趣，三者尊重如來，四者圓滿諸願。
translation: One is to surpass bad destinies, two is to be born in a good destiny, three honors the Tathāgata, and four fulfills the vows.

source_sentence: 復有四法所應學處。
translation: Again, there are four things that should be studied.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者於菩提心常不捨離，二者於諸眾生心行平等，三者於波羅蜜精進修行，四者聞無量法不生恐怖。
translation: One, he never abandons the mind of enlightenment, two, he conducts himself equally with all sentient beings, three, he diligently cultivates the perfection, and four, he hears measureless things and doesn't become frightened.

source_sentence: 復有四法學處清淨。
translation: There are another four things that make a place of training pure.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者不造諸惡，二者深解空性，三者不謗諸佛，四者滅壞諸見。
translation: One doesn't do evil, two has a deep understanding of emptiness, three doesn't denigrate the buddhas, and four destroys views.

source_sentence: 復有四法三昧種姓。
translation: "Again, there are four samādhi castes of qualities.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者離憒閙故，二者樂寂靜故，三者心無亂故，四者善根增故。
translation: 1. because they're free of anxiety, 2. because they enjoy calm, 3. because their minds are not disturbed, and 4. because their good roots increase.

source_sentence: 復有四法如理之心應當成就。
translation: There are another four things that a mind that's based on principle should accomplish.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者所修善法迴趣菩提，二者心常宴寂無有執著，三者於解脫門常勤修習，四者曾不求證二乘涅槃。
translation: One, the good qualities they cultivate lead back to enlightenment, two, the mind always remains quiescent and lacks attachment, three, they always diligently cultivate the gate of liberation, and four, they never sought to realize second-vehicle nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 復有四法不如理心應當捨離。
translation: There are another four things that are not reasonable and should be abandoned by the mind.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者於諸生死有所怖畏，二者於所修行不生信受，三者於祕密教不求勝解，四者於諸善根而不修習。
translation: One has fear of birth and death, two doesn't have faith in what's being practiced, three doesn't seek to understand the esoteric teaching, and four doesn't cultivate the good roots.

source_sentence: 復有四法正思惟心應善修學。
translation: There are another four things that should be well cultivated by a mind that correctly contemplates.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者菩薩乃至為一眾生，於無量劫受生死苦；二者應先了知一切眾生根性差別，而為說法令捨煩惱；三者應當斷一切惡、修一切善，降伏魔軍，證於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提；四者當為三千大千世界無量眾生，以一梵音演諸法要。
translation: First, a bodhisattva might even undertake the suffering of birth-and-death for a single sentient being for an immeasurable number of eons; second, he should first understand the differences in the root natures of all sentient beings and explain the principles of abandoning affliction; third, he should end all evil and cultivate all goodness, subdue the armies of Māra, and realize supreme perfect enlightenment; and fourth, he should explain the essentials of the Dharma with a single Brahma voice for an immeasurable number of sentient beings in a world of 3,000 great one-thousand worlds.

source_sentence: 復有四法無怯弱心魔不能摧。
translation: There are another four things that Māra can't destroy in a timid or weak mind.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者觀一切法猶如幻化，二者常與如理正智相應，三者於一切法無所分別，四者於一切相無所執著。
translation: One observes that all things are like illusory transformations, two is always associated with correct knowledge of the principle, three has no discrimination of all things, and four has no attachment to all characteristics.

source_sentence: 復有四法思惟於義。
translation: There are also four things to contemplate regarding their meaning.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者知一切法從因緣生，二者知無少法名為起者，三者知緣生法彼即無起，四者知法無生亦無滅壞。
translation: One knows that all things arise from causes and conditions, two knows that there are few things called arisings, three knows that conditioned arises are no arises at all, and four knows that things lack birth and lack cessation and decay.

source_sentence: 復有四法不捨眾生。
translation: There are another four things that he doesn't abandon to sentient beings.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者不捨弘願，二者忍於疲苦，三者不惜身命，四者恒修四攝。
translation: One doesn't abandon the great vow, two tolerates suffering, three doesn't spare his life, and four cultivates the four disciplines constantly.

source_sentence: 復有四法不應捨離。
translation: There are another four things that shouldn't be abandoned.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者於諸布施而不捨離，二者成熟眾生而不捨離，三者常自覺察而不捨離，四者增長他善而不捨離。
translation: One doesn't abandon generosity, two doesn't abandon ripening sentient beings, three always perceives it for himself and doesn't abandon it, and four increases the goodness of others and doesn't abandon it.

source_sentence: 復有四法常應攝受。
translation: There are another four things that should always be taken in.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者微少善根亦當修習，二者增長他善心無懈怠，三者聞說施戒則能信受，四者不求一切利養名譽。
translation: One, they'll cultivate even the slightest good roots, two, they'll cultivate the goodness of others without laziness, three, they'll accept the precepts when they hear and teach them, and four, they won't seek any profit or fame.

source_sentence: 復有四法入於正行。
translation: Again, there are four things that enter into right practice.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者成就通智，二者住大三昧，三者修習空性，四者無所執著。
translation: One accomplishes penetrating wisdom, two abides in great samādhi, three cultivates emptiness, and four has no attachment whatsoever.

source_sentence: 復有四法善巧方便。
translation: There are also four other things that are skillful means.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者菩薩於諸發心，以菩提心而為上首，乃至煩惱猶令順趣無上菩提，何況發起諸善心等；二者觀諸眾生乃至住於邪見之者皆為法器；三者了知諸法無有自性；四者修習解脫於三昧門無執著想。
translation: First, when a bodhisattva initiates various mental states, he takes the lead with the mind of bodhi, even when afflicted, so that he can still pursue unsurpassed bodhi, let alone the initiation of good mental states; second, he observes that all sentient beings and even those who abide in mistaken views are all Dharma vessels; third, he understands that all dharmas lack self-nature; and fourth, he cultivates liberation through the gate of samādhi without the perception of attachment.

source_sentence: 復有四法修大慈心。
translation: There are another four ways to cultivate a mind of great compassion.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者修大慈心救護眾生，二者修大慈心度脫眾生，三者修大慈心覺悟眾生，四者修大慈心為令眾生入涅槃故。
translation: One cultivates the mind of great compassion to rescue sentient beings, two cultivates the mind of great compassion to liberate sentient beings, three cultivates the mind of great compassion to enlighten sentient beings, and four cultivates the mind of great compassion in order to cause sentient beings to enter nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 復有四法修大悲心。
translation: There are another four ways to cultivate the mind of great compassion.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者修大悲心為令眾生離諸惡道住善趣故，二者修大悲心為令眾生捨諸惡行習善法故，三者修大悲心為令眾生離於小乘入大乘故，四者修大悲心為令眾生離於生死得涅槃故。
translation: One, cultivating the mind of great compassion causes sentient beings to part with bad destinies and abide in good destinies; two, cultivating the mind of great compassion causes sentient beings to abandon bad actions and cultivate good qualities; three, cultivating the mind of great compassion causes sentient beings to part with the lesser vehicle and enter the greater vehicle; and four, cultivating the mind of great compassion causes sentient beings to part with birth-and-death and attain nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 復有四法成就神通。
translation: "There are another four things that accomplish supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者不惜身命無愛戀故，二者了一切法如幻化故，三者於諸眾生起尊重故，四者修奢摩他無散亂故。
translation: One, it's because he doesn't spare his life and has no craving for it, two, it's because he understands all things as illusory, three, it's because he shows respect for sentient beings, and four, it's because he cultivates calming meditation and isn't distracted.

source_sentence: 復有四法得無礙辯。
translation: There are another four things that attain unhindered discernment.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者隨順於義不隨於文，二者隨順於法不隨於人，三者了達諸法離於文字，四者依了文字演說無盡。
translation: One follows the meaning and not the words, two follows the teaching and not the person, three comprehends the teaching apart from the words, and four relies on comprehending the words and explaining them endlessly.

source_sentence: 復有四法得陀羅尼。
translation: There are also four ways to attain the dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者於諸多聞無有厭足，二者於多聞者恭敬供養，三者以種種名說真實義，四者隨祕密教能正趣入。
translation: One, they don't tire of being well-versed, two, they respect and make offerings to those who are well-versed, three, they explain the true meaning in various terms, and four, they follow the esoteric teaching to be able to correctly enter it.

source_sentence: 復有四法能得法忍。
translation: There are also four ways to attain patience with regard to the teaching.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者多修勝解，二者無有退轉，三者資糧圓滿，四者精勤無倦。
translation: One is who cultivates a lot of excellent understanding, two has no turning back, three has a complete accumulation, and four is diligent and untiring.

source_sentence: 復有四法得淨辯才。
translation: There are also four ways to attain pure eloquence.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者於說法人無所違逆，二者尊重法師恭敬聽受，三者不以多聞而自憍慢，四者於少聞者不生輕賤。
translation: 1) He doesn't disobey anyone who teaches, 2) he respects the teacher of the Dharma and listens to him respectfully, 3) he doesn't become proud of himself because he's heard so much, and 4) he doesn't despise those who have heard little.

source_sentence: 復有四法應當捨離。
translation: There are another four things you should abandon.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者於貪瞋癡應當捨離，二者於聲聞乘應當捨離，三者於緣覺乘應當捨離，四者於善法想應當捨離。
translation: 1) greed, anger, and delusion should be abandoned, 2) the vehicle of the direct disciples should be abandoned, 3) the vehicle of the solitary realizers should be abandoned, and 4) the conception of good qualities should be abandoned.

source_sentence: 復有四法入甚深義。
translation: There are another four things that enter a very profound sense.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者於有為法深達緣起，二者於祕密義能正了知，三者於諸法性深生正解，四者於一切法了達空義。
translation: One is a person who deeply understands the dependent arising of existent phenomena, two is able to correctly comprehend the esoteric meaning, three is able to deeply produce a correct understanding of the nature of all dharmas, and four is able to comprehend the meaning of emptiness in all dharmas.

source_sentence: 復有四法令願圓滿。
translation: There are another four vows that he fulfills.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者尸羅清淨，二者淨除惡業，三者無有諂誑，四者增長善根。
translation: One, the śīla is purified, two, the bad karma is purified, three, there's no flattery, and four, the good roots are developed.

source_sentence: 復有四法於諸波羅蜜而得不退轉。
translation: There are another four things that make the perfections irreversible.

source_sentence: 云何為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者以善巧方便能於一波羅蜜遍通諸波羅蜜，二者以善巧方便隨了一眾生遍了一切眾生，三者以善巧方便證於一法清淨遍證一切諸法清淨，四者以善巧方便了知一佛遍能了知一切諸佛。
translation: One, by skillful means he can universally penetrate the perfections of one perfection, two, by skillful means he follows one sentient being and universally penetrates all sentient beings, three, by skillful means he realizes the purity of one thing and universally realizes the purity of all things, and four, by skillful means he knows one Buddha and universally knows all Buddhas.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 由於法性無差別故。」
translation: It's because the nature of dharmas has no distinctions."

source_sentence: 佛說如是菩薩四法門時，幻師跋陀羅證無生忍，心懷踊悅，即昇虛空其身去地七多羅量。
translation: When the Buddha explained these four bodhisattva teachings, the phantasmal master Bhadrapāla realized the patient acceptance of nonarising and became so elated that he ascended into space and took his body to the ground seven tārāas deep.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊熙怡微笑，從其面門放無量光，其光普照諸佛世界，還於如來頂上而沒。
translation: The Bhagavān then smiled joyfully and radiated a measureless light from his face, which shone universally on all the buddha-worlds and sank back down on top of the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 爾時尊者阿難作是念言：「如來、應、正等覺現此微笑非無因緣。」
translation: Venerable Ānanda then had this thought, "It's not for lack of a reason that the Tathāgata, Arhat, and Completely Awakened One is smiling like this."

source_sentence: 即從座起，偏袒右肩右膝著地，合掌向佛，以偈問曰：「普聞三界遍知尊，　　威德智處難思者，　已達菩提功德岸，　　今現微笑有何緣？
translation: He rose from his seat, bared his right shoulder, knelt on his right knee, put his palms together, and addressed the Buddha with a verse, asking, "What are the reasons why the Tathāgata, the honored one who has universal knowledge of the three realms, who has unfathomable abilities and knowledge, and who has reached the shore of the merit of bodhi, is smiling now?

source_sentence: 十方五趣諸眾生，　　心行種性上中下，　如來於彼悉能了，　　今現微笑有何緣？
translation: "What is the reason the Tathāgata smiles now when he can fully understand the five destinies of sentient beings in the ten directions, the higher, middle, and lower seed natures of their minds and behaviors?

source_sentence: 人天八部諸大眾，　　所出種種妙音聲，　比於如來清淨音，　　乃至不及歌羅分。
translation: The various wonderful sounds emanating from the eight groups of humans and gods are even less pure than the Tathāgata's, even if they're not as loud as Kālāśyapa's.

source_sentence: 世尊光明遍十方，　　普照無量諸佛剎，　日月摩尼梵天光，　　無有能比如來者。
translation: The Bhagavān's light pervades the ten directions, universally illuminating measureless buddha bases, and there's no Brahmā's light like the Tathāgata's in the sun and moon.

source_sentence: 已了性空甚深法，　　無我無人及眾生，　有無二邊皆捨離，　　善知三際如水月。
translation: He has understood the profound dharma of essential emptiness, has no self, no humans, and no sentient beings, has abandoned both the extremes of existence and nonexistence, and well knows the three realms like the watery moon.

source_sentence: 今誰趣於最上乘，　　紹繼如來法種性，　生於廣大三寶中？
translation: Who now goes to the supreme vehicle, inherits the Tathāgata's Dharma seed nature, and is born among the vast Three Treasures?

source_sentence: 微笑因緣願宣說。
translation: "I'd like to explain the causes and conditions for smiling.

source_sentence: 如來所現微笑光，　　為彼諸乘有差別，　於膝於肩而沒者，　　如斯為彼二乘人。
translation: The Tathāgata's smiling radiance is discriminated for those vehicles, and those who sink at the knees and shoulders are thus adherents of the two vehicles.

source_sentence: 今者所放無量光，　　此光入於如來頂，　天中勝者為何人，　　於此佛乘當授記？」
translation: Now, he radiates an immeasurable light, and that light enters the Tathāgata's head. Who among gods is the victorious one who will be given a prediction of this Buddha's vehicle?"

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告阿難言：「汝今見是跋陀羅不？」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Ānanda, "Do you see this Bhadra now?"

source_sentence: 白言：「已見。」
translation: He said, "I've seen it."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「此善男子，過於九萬二千劫，於大莊嚴土善化劫中當得成佛，號曰神變王如來、應、正等覺。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "This good man, after 92,000 eons, will attain Buddhahood in an eon of good transformation in a land of great adornment, and he'll be called the miraculous king Tathāgata, Arhat, and Completely Awakened One.

source_sentence: 彼佛國土人民熾盛安隱豐樂，地平柔軟如兜羅綿，花果諸樹次第行列，幢幡寶蓋以為莊嚴，眾樂自鳴妙香充遍，所須飲食應念而至，諸所受用資生之具，如忉利天而無有異。
translation: The people of that Buddha's land are abundant, peaceful, and abundant, the ground is smooth and supple like a cotton wool, flowers and fruits line up in succession, banners, streamers, and jeweled shrouds adorn it, the music that sounds spontaneously fills it with wonderful fragrances, the food and drink that's needed comes as often as one wishes, and the necessities of life that are enjoyed are like those of the Heaven of Thirty-three without distinction.

source_sentence: 彼國常現種種莊嚴，是故號為大莊嚴土。
translation: That country always displays various kinds of adornment, which is why it's called the land of great adornment.

source_sentence: 於彼國內一切人民，皆住大乘深信堅固。
translation: All the people in that country abide in the great vehicle with deep and resolute faith.

source_sentence: 彼神變王如來壽十千歲，正法住世滿百億年。
translation: That miracle king tathāgata lives for 10,000 years, and the true teaching remains in the world for 10 billion years.

source_sentence: 臨涅槃時，授名稱菩薩阿耨多羅三藐三菩提記，告言：『汝於來世次當作佛，號一切最勝如來、應、正等覺。』」
translation: When he was about to reach nirvāṇa, he gave the bodhisattva the name Anuttarasamyak-saṃbodhicitta the assurance of his enlightenment and told him, 'In the next life, you'll be crowned next as a buddha, and you'll be called the most excellent of all tathāgatas, arhats, and correct enlightenment.'"

source_sentence: 時跋陀羅聞於如來如是記已，從空而下，頂禮佛足而作是言：「我今歸命如來、應、正等覺及法、比丘。」
translation: After hearing this assurance from the Tathāgata, Bhadra descended from the sky, bowed his head at the Buddha's feet, and said, "Now I take refuge in the Tathāgata, the Worthy One, the Completely Enlightened One, the Dharma, and the Bhikṣus."

source_sentence: 如是慇懃無量俱胝數百千遍。
translation: He thus courted them measurelessly and koṭīnately a hundred thousand times.

source_sentence: 復作是言：「如佛世尊以於真如無有異故，說一切法不異真如，乃至無有差別、無有缺減、無有分別、無生無作。
translation: Again, he said, "Just as the Bhagavān explains that all things are not different from the true nature because there's nothing different about the true nature, so there are no distinctions, no deficiencies, no discriminations, and nothing that's produced or made.

source_sentence: 我今歸依亦復如是。」
translation: My present refuge is likewise."

source_sentence: 爾時尊者阿難謂跋陀羅言：「汝若如佛所說真如而歸依者，汝今豈於佛法性中有所得耶？」
translation: It was then that the Venerable Ānanda addressed Bhadra, "If you had relied on the Buddha's teaching about true thusness, wouldn't you now have attained something in the Buddha's Dharma nature?"

source_sentence: 幻師答言：「我身即是如來法性。
translation: The illusionist replied, "My body is the Tathāgata's Dharma nature.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 我及如來無二無別，一切諸法皆真如故。
translation: "I and the Tathāgata are not two, and there's no distinction between them, so all things are truly true.

source_sentence: 言真如者，則一切法無差別性，一切眾生亦復如是。
translation: When it's called true, then all things lack discriminating qualities, and so do all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 尊者當知，言無二者，無所分別是為無二。
translation: You should know, Venerable, that when it's said to be nondual, the absence of discrimination is nonduality.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 遍知諸法但有名字，是佛智故。」
translation: Pervasive knowledge of dharmas that only have names is the result of the Buddha's wisdom."

source_sentence: 尊者阿難前白佛言：「奇哉世尊！
translation: Venerable Ānanda went before the Buddha and said, "How wonderful, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此跋陀羅乃有如是智慧辯才。
translation: This Bhadra has such wisdom and eloquence.

source_sentence: 昔以幻化惑亂世間，今時復以智慧惑亂。」
translation: In the past, he used illusory transformations to confuse the world, but now he's using wisdom to confuse it again."

source_sentence: 佛告跋陀羅言：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha told Bhadrapāla, "Good man!

source_sentence: 汝實爾耶？」
translation: Is that true of you?"

source_sentence: 跋陀羅言：「如佛所作惑亂之事，我亦如是惑亂世間。
translation: Bhadra said, "Just as the Buddha did something that disturbed the world, so I've disturbed the world.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 謂佛世尊於無我中說有眾生及壽命者，此於世間是大惑亂。
translation: For the Bhagavān to say that there are sentient beings and life forms in the absence of self is a great confusion in the world.

source_sentence: 如於如來證菩提已，不見少法是生死往來而說生死往來。
translation: It's like the Tathāgata who, after realizing enlightenment, doesn't see a little bit of the past and future of birth-and-death and then talks about the past and future of birth-and-death.

source_sentence: 如我意者，唯有如來是大惑亂。」
translation: If that's what I think, then only the Tathāgata is a great confusion."

source_sentence: 佛言：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha said, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 善哉善哉，如汝所說。
translation: "Good, good, as you say.

source_sentence: 諸佛如來於無我中乃至無有生死往來，而隨世俗說眾生等。
translation: The buddha-tathāgatas lack self, even if there's no passing through birth and death, and they follow the conventional teaching about sentient beings and so forth.

source_sentence: 亦無少法名為涅槃，然為證得涅槃法故說於涅槃。」
translation: There's no little thing called nirvāṇa, but they teach about nirvāṇa in order to realize the teaching of nirvāṇa."

source_sentence: 時跋陀羅聞是說已，前白佛言：「我願出家作於比丘。」
translation: After hearing this, Bhadra went forward and said to the Buddha, "I'd like to leave home and become a monk."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告彌勒菩薩摩訶薩言：「汝當與是善男子剃除鬚髮授具足戒。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Maitreya Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, "You must shave off your hair and confer the full precepts on this good man."

source_sentence: 彌勒菩薩承佛教旨，即與出家受於具戒。
translation: In response to the Buddha's order, Maitreya readied himself for renunciation and received the full set of precepts.

source_sentence: 既出家已，復白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Once he had left home, he again said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此出家者唯形相耳非真出家。
translation: This kind of renunciant is merely a formality, not a true renunciant.

source_sentence: 若諸菩薩真出家者，謂離諸相處於三界成熟眾生，方可名為真出家也。」
translation: Only when bodhisattvas are truly renunciant is it called truly renunciant to be free of all appearances and to abide in the three realms to mature sentient beings."

source_sentence: 說是語時，五千眾生發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，皆於諸漏心得解脫。
translation: When he spoke these words, 5,000 sentient beings aroused the mind of unsurpassed, correct enlightenment and liberation from the contaminants.

source_sentence: 爾時阿難白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that Ānanda said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 當何名此經？
translation: What will be the name of this sūtra?

source_sentence: 我等云何奉持？」
translation: What do we do to uphold it?"

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「此經名為『授幻師跋陀羅記法門』，亦名『漸證菩提法門』。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "This sūtra is called 'The Dharma Gate of Granting the Illusory Master Bhadra's Notes,' and it's also called 'The Dharma Gate of Gradual Realization of Enlightenment.'

source_sentence: 若有眾生於未來世欲見如來及為眾生作佛事者，當於此經受持讀誦廣為人說。
translation: If there are sentient beings in the future who want to see the Tathāgata and perform Buddha-works for sentient beings, they should memorize, recite, and teach this sūtra to others.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 是人則為已見如來，亦已為他施作佛事。
translation: That person then has seen the Tathāgata and has given alms to others to perform Buddha-works.

source_sentence: 是故阿難！
translation: Therefore, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若於此經受持讀誦流通之者，則為哀愍利樂眾生。
translation: "If someone memorizes, recites, and disseminates this sūtra, then they are compassionate toward the welfare of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 若欲發趣無上菩提，亦於此經當勤修習。
translation: If they want to set out for unsurpassed bodhi, they should also diligently cultivate this sūtra.

source_sentence: 此經能出無上菩提，此經能生無上菩提，是故此經亦復名為『出生菩提』。
translation: This sūtra can give rise to unsurpassed bodhi, and this sūtra can give rise to unsurpassed bodhi; therefore, this sūtra is also called 'giving rise to bodhi.'

source_sentence: 若有受持此經典者，當知諸佛止住其身，何況於中如理修行。」
translation: If anyone accepts and retains this sūtra, they should know that the buddhas stand still in their bodies, so why wouldn't they cultivate them according to reality?"

source_sentence: 時跋陀羅復白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Bhadra then again said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此經亦名『發覺善根』。
translation: This sūtra is also called 'Finding Good Roots.'

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 今於佛所得聞是經，一切善根皆現前故。」
translation: Now, when I hear this sūtra from the Buddha, all my good roots will come forth."

source_sentence: 佛說是經已，尊者阿難及跋陀羅，天人大眾、阿修羅、乾闥婆等，聞佛所說，皆大歡喜，信受奉行。
translation: After the Buddha taught this sūtra, Venerable Ānanda and Bhadra, the gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas who heard what he taught rejoiced greatly, believed, and approved.

source_sentence: 大寶積經卷第八十五
translation: Da baoji jing, vol. 85
